alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Lee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 4:26PM EDT until July 05 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Harnett, Johnston, Lee and Wake. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations may be occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms has largely ended and only light rain remains. However, minor flooding may be ongoing in the advisory area due to the earlier heavy rainfall. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Coats, Broadway, Duncan, Raven Rock State Park, Harris Lake Boat Launch, Shearon Harris Reservoir and Seminole.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads.
